biography: Erin Trieb works professionally as a freelance photojournalist, documentary photographer and filmmaker.  In her work Erin focuses on social issue-driven topics like cultural identity, trauma from war, and feminism - her photography spans a diversity of subject matter from international conflict to feature stories. Based in Istanbul, Erin works for a variety of clients including The New York Times, ESPN Magazine, Rolling Stone, NBCnews.com, Newsweek, TIME Magazine, Harper’s, Playboy, and many others. In 2017 she was named a “female icon” of adventure by Outside Magazine.Theresa Breuer is a writer and filmmaker whose work focuses on in-depth human interest stories that delve beyond news headlines. Most recently, her stories have led her to hitchhike with Iranian beatniks, convey war stories from the perspective of Syrian refugee children, and cover female Palestinian race car drivers defying their male competitors. Her clients include major German and international outlets such as Stern, Der Spiegel, Die Zeit, Neon, Vice, Buzzfeed, The Wall Street Journal, Great Big Story and Al Jazeera America.Erin and Theresa are directors, camera operators, and producers of AN UPHILL BATTLE film.

biography: The Borninfornia Brand was founded in 2013 by two longtime best friends, Andrew Sutton and Daniel Calvert.BORNINFORNIA MOTTOS:Everything Community: We at Borninfornia don't want to be another clothing brand that simply sells products to anonymous customers. We want Borninfornia to lead to long-lasting relationships that benefits the great state of California as much as it does our wardrobes. We don't want to create clothing for you, we want to create clothing with you. We will never have automated phone support. We will never use copy-and-paste email replies. We will never try to maximize profits in lieu of your satisfaction. We want to be Facebook friends with you. We want to follow you on Twitter. We want to check out your Instagram photos. We want your input when we are designing new products. We are not here to only provide a product but rather an experience. We want to create a community. We want to create a brand that is as great as our state.100% California: Everything about Borninfornia from the ground up is 100% California. The idea and concept was created by two friends who have spent their whole entire life residing in The Golden State. All the shirt blanks come from an apparel company based out of Los Angeles. The clothing labels also come from the City of Angels before they are hand-sewn onto the shirts by Borninfornia's own founders. All screen-printing is completed by a San Diego based company. Pending a successful Kickstarter Campaign, we will contract with a Carlsbad-based apparel agency to oversee the entire shirt making process.Check us out at www.borninfornia.com!

biography:
Bryan Tillman has been in higher education for over 13 years and has done everything from professor to program director for Media. He is currently an Assistant Professor for Graphic Design at Norfolk State University. Bryan has an MFA from the Savannah College of Art and Design, with a focus in sequential art and a minor in drawing. As an educator Bryan has conducted many panels and solo lectures for many convention such as, AwesomeCon, MegaCon, Stan Lee's Comikaze, Wizard World Conventions and San Diego Comic Con. The San Diego Comic Con has over the past 10 years invited him back to give his panel on Proper Pitching and Promoting Yourself. Bleeding cool did an article on it in 2017.· https://www.bleedingcool.com/2017/07/26/comic-con-bryan-tillmans-five-rules-self-promotion-pitching/.
Aside from being an educator, Bryan is the owner and CEO of the Kaiser Studio Productions LLC, a production studio for comics, toys, animation, and games that has been active in the industry for over 16 years. Some of the clients that Bryan has worked for are Marvel Comics, DC Comics, Image Comics, Valiant Comics, UpperDeck, Cryptozoic, Rittenhouse, Toys R Us, T.G.I. Fridays, Focal Press, FX, Miramax and Tandem Productions..
Bryan has published three instructional books; one for Focal Press: Creative Character Design, one for CDR Press: Creative Character Design VOL 2 and one for Kaiser Studio Productions: The 30 Day Pitch Bible. Bryan has also created and illustrated a tabletop RPG trading card game, Dark Legacy, which was recently acquired by UpperDeck and was released to stores in late 2018..
Currently Bryan is hard at work getting ready to bring Ninja Empire to the public. Ninja Empire is comic book series of five separate stories that deal with a world that is run by ninjas. This will be the first time that Bryan has released comic books that he has both written and illustrated.
